item.title: Katie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jackson Tippett McCrae
item.description: "Why America has never made the connection between tract housing and psychosis is beyond me" -- Jackson Tippett McCrae

item.title: Katie add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Strip back the beliefs pasted on by governesses, schools, and states, you find indelible truths at one's core." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Katie add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "People are obscenities. Would rather be music than be a mass of tubes squeezing semisolids around itself for a few decades before becoming so dribblesome it'll no longer function." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Katie add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Torturous advances won over generations can be lost by a single stroke of a myopic president's pen or a vainglorious general's sword." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Katie add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description: "I am at the moment writing a lengthy indictment against our century. When my brain begins to reel from my literary labors, I make an occasional cheese dip." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: Katie add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Nobody wants to be here and nobody wants to leave." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Katie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Katie add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "This is the way the world ends Not with a bang but a whimper." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Katie add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Every gathering has its moment. As an adult, I distract myself by trying to identify it, dreading the inevitable downswing that is sure to follow. The guests will repeat themselves one too many times, or you'll run out of dope or liquor and realize that it was all you ever had in common." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Katie add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "All of us take pride and pleasure in the fact that we are unique, but I'm afraid that when all is said and done the police are right: it all comes down to fingerprints." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Katie add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Katie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Show me a man or a woman alone and I'll show you a saint. Give me two and they'll fall in love. Give me three and they'll invent the charming thing we call 'society'. Give me four and they'll build a pyramid. Give me five and they'll make one an outcast. Give me six and they'll reinvent prejudice. Give me seven and in seven years they'll reinvent warfare. Man may have been made in the image of God, but human society was made in the image of His opposite number, and is always trying to get back home." -- Stephen King

item.title: Katie add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "If you show someone something you've written, you give them a sharpened stake, lie down in your coffin, and say, ‘When you’re ready’." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Katie add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "It is one of the strange discoveries a man can make that life, however you lead it, contains moments of exhilaration; there are always comparisons which can be made with worse times: even in danger and misery the pendulum swings." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jeannette Walls
item.description: "[Marriage] made the hard moments easier and the good moments better." -- Jeannette Walls

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jeannette Walls
item.description: "Living there [Horse Mesa] was like living in a natural cathedral. Waking up every morning, you walked outside and looked down at the blue lake, then up at the sandstone cliffs--those awe-inspiring layers of red and yellow rock shaped over the millennia, with dozens of black-streaked crevices that temporarily became waterfalls after rainstorms." -- Jeannette Walls

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "Like all failed experiments, that one taught me something I didn’t expect: one key ingredient of so-called experience is the delusional faith that it is unique and special, that those included in it are privileged and those excluded from it are missing out." -- Jennifer Egan
